alert.note: Alert for Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 29 at 11:37PM EST until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CST/145 AM EST/ MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in southeast Alabama, Coffee, Dale, Henry and Houston. In southwest Georgia, Clay, Early, Quitman and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM CST /145 AM EST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1037 PM CST /1137 PM EST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 Hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daleville, Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Headland, Georgetown, Dothan, Ozark, Fort Rucker, Enterprise, Midland City, Kinsey, Level Plains, Newton, Webb, Pinckard, Grimes, Newville, Napier Field and Bellville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
